name: Anna R. Karlin
content: Anna R. Karlin, Professor - Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering Skip to content Enter search text Current site All the UW Search scope Current site All the UW Anna R. Karlin Professor Associate Director of Graduate Studies Bill & Melinda Gates Chair in Computer Science & Engineering Focus Area: Theory & Models of Computation Expertise: Algorithms Email: karlin@cs.washington.edu Office: CSE 586 Faculty Webpage Theory of Computation Group Biography: Anna Karlin, the Bill & Melinda Gates Chair in Computer Science & Engineering, received her Ph.D. from Stanford University in 1987. Before coming to the University of Washington, she spent 5 years as a researcher at (what was then) Digital Equipment Corporation’s Systems Research Center. Karlin’s research is primarily in theoretical computer science: the design and analysis of algorithms, particularly probabilistic and online algorithms. She also works at the interface between theory and other areas, such as economics and game theory, data mining, operating systems, networks, and distributed systems.
